subject: Re: Custom Test Suite...
msgSnippet: That doesn t sound unreasonable, at least to me.  A simpler (although probably not, by any stretch of the imagination, better) would be something like: public
messageBody:
That doesn't sound unreasonable, at least to me. A simpler (although
probably not, by any stretch of the imagination, better) would be
something like:

public void testUnmarshelledMessage() {

StringBuffer errorMessage = new StringBuffer();

try {
File path = new File("/home/mark/testmessages");
File[] files = path.listFiles();

for (int i = 0; i < files.length; i++) {
File file = files[i];

if (file.getName().startsWith("test") && file.getName
().endsWith("xml")) {
Reader reader = new FileReader(file.getAbsoluteFile());

// stubbing out the actual code...replace with the real
functions of course
String testMessage = "";
String result = "";

if (testMessage == null || !testMessage.equals(result)) {

errorMessage.append("\r\n");
errorMessage.append(testMessage);
errorMessage.append("> not equals to <");
errorMessage.append(result);
errorMessage.append(">");

errors.add(errorMessage.toString());
}
}
}
catch (Exception e) {
errorMessage.append("\r\n");
errorMessage.append(e.getMessage());
}

if (errorMessage.length() > 0) {
fail("Unmarshalling failed with the following errors: " +
errorMessage.toString());
}
}

You get the general idea...just build up a list of the errors, then
fail later on.

-Eric
